pullRequest.body:
Currently `CategoryTheory.Abelian.ProjectiveResolution` requires more than double the next largest file in terms of CPU instructions. This reduces the load by replacing ad-hoc `MkStruct` with `ShortComplex` and pushing around the existing proof. Follow-up clean-up should be done.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/643f2ff4-a544-46d9-8dd2-31d7b9503193) for commit a26de5d265ad4573558b39e3c5656b944483c0bb.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/0b7a35da-ccfa-4292-9d3d-e20343ab8edb/to/643f2ff4-a544-46d9-8dd2-31d7b9503193) against commit f880f9c4d36144973951f8255fdea629c02feeac:
```diff
  Benchmark                                              Metric             Change
  ================================================================================
+ build                                                  tactic execution    -5.5%
+ ~Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Abelian.ProjectiveResolution   instructions       -86.7%
```

:v: mattrobball can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7454324665/job/20281439317)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7454324665/job/20281438654)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7454324665/job/20281439157)

I know it is orthogonal to this speed-up, but would you mind renaming `flat` to something like `asTuple`? Because `ShortComplex.flat` gives me all kinds of "commutative algebra flatness" vibes that have nothing todo with this defn.

This looks great!
If we change the type of `succ`, we may remove the definition of `asTuple`:
```suggestion
  (succ : ∀ (S : ShortComplex V),
      Σ' (X₃ : V) (d₂ : X₃ ⟶ S.X₁), d₂ ≫ S.f = 0)
```
Then `mkAux` can be defined as
```lean
def mkAux : ℕ → ShortComplex V
  | 0 => ShortComplex.mk _ _ s
  | n + 1 => ShortComplex.mk _ _ (succ (mkAux n)).2.2
```
Then the definition of `mk'` can be adjusted as:
```lean
def mk' (X₀ X₁ : V) (d : X₁ ⟶ X₀)
    (succ' : ∀ {X₀ X₁ : V} (f : X₁ ⟶ X₀), Σ' (X₂ : V) (d : X₂ ⟶ X₁), d ≫ f = 0) :
    ChainComplex V ℕ :=
  mk _ _ _ _ _ (succ' d).2.2 (fun S => succ' S.f)
```

And finally, in `Abelian.ProjectiveResolution`, `ofComplex` can be defined as
```lean
def ofComplex : ChainComplex C ℕ :=
  ChainComplex.mk' (Projective.over Z) (Projective.syzygies (Projective.π Z))
    (Projective.d (Projective.π Z)) (fun f => ⟨_, Projective.d f, by simp⟩)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - perf (Homology.ProjectiveResolution): remove `MkStruct`, re-jigger proof, and suppress compilation
